A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The first words of TFA were\, \"This will begin to set things right.\" I only wish that TLJ had tried to live up to that promise. Until last night I had never seen a Star Wars movie that I didn't like\, and yes\, I'm including the made for tv Ewok movies from the 80's.  But TLJ has succeeded in putting a bad taste in my mouth. It was so bad I couldn't sleep after watching it. Rian Johnson took maybe the most iconic character in movie history and destroyed him. I can't comprehend what he was thinking with this script or how Lucasfilm or Disney green lit it. At this point I don't know if I want to see more of this trilogy. Thanks for breaking the franchise guys.
